intro: Tetratheca setigera var. elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed white everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its white, tubular flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, woody fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
